result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah Nevell Beavers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting An Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Sign up for probation no later than 7/29/22.

miscConds.notes:
Submit a DNA sample BY 7/29/22 and pay the surcharge during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Pay ALL costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah Nevell Beavers

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Isaiah Nevell Beavers in court with attorney Tyler David Rasmussen.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea(s) to NO CONTEST. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
* 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 1 day time served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 9 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 7/29/22.
- Complete 35 hours of community service.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription
- Obtain/maintain full time school/work.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Submit a DNA sample BY 7/29/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay ALL costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.

Defendant Isaiah Nevell Beavers in court with attorney Tyler David Rasmussen.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Rasmussen requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (5/13/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Isaiah Nevell Beavers in court.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Rasmussen could not make the initial appearance this afternoon.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 01.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 045187,
Payable Number: 1005598,
Receipt Number: 22RP018894,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/11/2022@1:30pm
